subtasks: Approach the cow and explain the initial setup
Use a rope to signal the cow to stand still
Relax the cow by petting and giving treats
Clean the cow's udder and teats with warm water and coconut oil
Discard the initial milk from each teat to eliminate bacteria
Position the bucket to catch milk while preventing the cow from kicking it over
Position the milker for comfortable milking (sitting, head rest)
Milk each teat starting from the back, working around to the front and avoiding cuts
Handle cow's movements and kicks to maintain control during milking
Collect and dispose of the milk
Provide treats and supplements to the cow
Relax the cow further by petting and giving attention

tasks.task: Training the cow for future milkings
subtasks: Reinforce behavior to stand still and remain calm during milking
Gradually reduce human assistance for milking
Reward desired behavior with treats and praise
Ensure a quiet, clean area for milking
Use calming techniques such as singing
Keep other animals (e.g., dogs) away during milking
Plan for future milkings, considering cow's feeding and rest needs
